titles.title: Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-427, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

It shall be in order on the legislative day of Thursday, May 2, 2002, for the Speaker to entertain a motion that the House suspend the rules relating to the resolution, H. Res. 392. If the motion is entertained, debate on the resolution shall be extended to one hour.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 148.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 404.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 328 - 82 (Roll no. 124).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 329 - 76 (Roll no. 125).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/1/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Makes it in order at any time on May 2, 2002, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain a motion that the House suspend the rules relating to H.Res. 392 (expressing solidarity with Israel in its fight against terrorism).
